subject: p11213613
Findings: Heart size is normal when allowances are made for prominent bilateral pericardial fat pads, shown to better detail on CT abdomen of. Mediastinal and hilar contours are within normal limits and without change. Lungs are remarkable for upper lobe predominant emphysema, more severe in the right upper lobe than the left. No new focal lung abnormalities were detected, and there are no pleural effusions. Mild compression deformity in the mid thoracic spine is unchanged.
Impression: Stable radiographic appearance of the chest with upper lobe predominant emphysema. No evidence of pneumonia. If symptoms persist, consider a chest CT for more complete evaluation if warranted clinically.
